intro: Muellera glaziovii var. praecox, commonly known as the early muellera, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane regions with high rainfall.
